product_name: Homsee Vanity Desk Set Makeup Table with Large Sliding Lighted Mirror, Dressing Table with 5 Drawers, Storage Shelves & Cushioned Stool for Bedroom, White
review_header: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE - Defective mirror and NO response!
review_text: I This piece is a little tedious to put together, with all the small parts, but once put together, it's very pretty. However, the biggest feature of this for me was the lighted mirror. After all the work to put it together, the mirror doesn't light up on half of it!!I have reached out 5 times, the mirror on this item is only working on half of it. I emailed the seller in the email that was provided with the package,  and was asked for the order info, I sent all the info, and then no response.I started over trying to get them to respond, again, asked for the order number and got no response. I reached on through Amazon, and no response. This seller is either horrible at service or doesn't care. This is unacceptable for an expensive table that you have to put together.I would suggest not buying, as if it doesn't work, something is missing or you need anything, you will NOT get any service.

product_name: Homsee Vanity Desk Set Makeup Table with Large Sliding Lighted Mirror, Dressing Table with 5 Drawers, Storage Shelves & Cushioned Stool for Bedroom, White
review_header: Holds all of my self-care products!
review_text: Took forever to put together, I recommend a power tool with a fully charged battery. Instantly after assembling I fell in love! The hidden storage behind the mirror is my favorite part. I did have to buy a ring light because the mirror light is too dim, but also I wear glasses and it’s hard to see without them so I may need more light than others. There was a scratch on the top of the desk part but my silicon mat covers it so it’s not a big deal. The blow dryer holder is great for my plow dry brush as well as the flat iron holder.I would say it meets expectations for the price. But seriously phone a friend (or two) to help put that thing together!
variant_name: Style: Upgrade White with Power Strip

review_text: It took 2 days to assemble the item. Assembly instructions unclear, some parts of the item were not labeled. One of the bottom drawer's front panel did not fit. I had to request and new one and submit a detailed description of the issue along with pictures. The requested part was delivered in 7 days. Overall, the item is not looking bad but it lacks stability. It is made of cheap material, definitely not good for storage of heavier glass or china dishes.

review_text: PROS:-Fairly easy to assemble-Look niceCONS:-Cheap material.-Top and Bottom section, so the cabinet ends up flimsy. Wish it would have been one big piece. It would have been a lot more steady that way. Make sure to hook it to the wallor it will tip over.-Some of the pieces were mislabeled.-Drawers can’t hold much weight, and there is no back on them so you can’t stack anything.-One of the drawer faces was really scratched. Reached out to the sellerwith no response.Overall they get the job done, and they do look nice from afar. Looking back, I wish we would have spent a little more money and bought a nicer set. product_name: AIEGLE Tall Bookcase with Glass Doors, 47.2" Wide Large 4-Tier Bookshelf with 4 Drawers, Freestanding China Cabinet Display Storage Cabinet for Living Room Office Storage, White

Overall, I will never purchase from this supplier again. It was a waste of money. As we say, you get what you pay for.Don't cut corners on cost.

The quality is great, but it takes a while to assemble so make sure you have your own tools.

product_name: ECACAD Vanity Desk Set with Round Mirror, Makeup Dressing Table with 5 Drawers, Storage Shelves & Cushioned Stool for Bedroom, White
review_text: This was a gift for my granddaughter and was selected for it’s look, drawers and lighted mirror. Having assembled several flat pack items previously I didn’t expect any unusual problems. To keep this short: the directions are marginal at best stating tools required is a hammer?, use all the nails on back panel to make unit sturdy none were provided, it stated “slides are marked left and right? there were no parts marked slides or any L or R, the stool was very small and I doubt it could even  hold a 5year old, two parts had small incorrect diameter holes drilled for cam locks and had to improvise to continue, 30% ofcam locks were poorly stamped and couldn’t identify “the point “ critical for proper alignment, the poor design left cam locks plainly visible on finished surfaces, etc, etc There’s more but…..A “Total Nightmare “is  being kind.

product_name: Pure Country Weavers Personalized Woven Photo Blanket - Not Printed - Custom Gift Picture Tapestry Throw 100% Cotton - Made in The USA (72x54)
review_header: Gorgeous, soft and thick photo afghan
review_text: Many years ago I purchased a photo afghan for my in-laws. It was a photograph of them with all of their children. My mother-in-law always had it on display on her sofa. When the second of the in-laws died, that Afghan was the one thing that all of the siblings wanted. They decided that each kid would get it for a year at a time and we would exchange it Thanksgiving.My husband is the oldest so we got the first year. We had a talk a few weeks ago and decided that we would purchase one for each of his sisters and brother. I ordered one as a sample from one of those photo printing places first. It was not nearly as nice as the one I had ordered for my mother-in-law. It was thin and stiff and the photo looked like it was printed on.I saw this company on Amazon and we decided we would try here. As before, I ordered just one. When it came, we were so excited because it was perfect! I immediately ordered four more and we have them to hand out at Thanksgiving. I am sure all of my in-laws are going to be thrilled with these afghans.I normally don't tell whole stories in a product review but, in this case, it was relevant. I wanted to get afghans for my in-laws that were just as nice as the original. This afghan is comfortable enough to use as a blanket and sturdy enough that it will hold up for many years. The photograph is beautiful. The price is very fair. I saw them for much more money at other places on the internet and try to place where it cost less and was not happy with the results.If you are looking for a memento photo blanket, this is absolutely the one I would recommend.

product_name: Pure Country Weavers Personalized Woven Photo Blanket - Not Printed - Custom Gift Picture Tapestry Throw 100% Cotton - Made in The USA (72x54)

review_text: This was purchased as a gift and the recipient loved it! The quality is excellent and the image is not distorted. A great buy.

product_name: Philips Norelco Multigroomer All-in-One Trimmer Series 3000, 13 Piece Mens Grooming Kit, for Beard, Face, Nose, and Ear Hair Trimmer and Hair Clipper, NO Blade Oil Needed, MG3750/60
review_text: I like how handy it can be to trim your hair, mustache, nouse or ear hair as the design is light and has attachments for different thing like the around of the ears, inside or trim the edge of the mustache. Works well while the battery is full but as it doesn't has a battery meter or light you don't know when it will go slow and then it start cutting slow and the speed is not as when fully charged. Even plugged is not too fast. The components looks good quality and show durability but I gave 4 starts for the battery life, lack of battery indicator and even plugged it don't give the 100%. When charged it works great.

review_text: I was expecting something of a little better quality when I opened this up. The razor feels very light and cheap. The on off button feels pretty cheap as well. As for the shave, it works fine which in the end is what really matters and so far hasn't broken yet.

product_name: Philips Norelco Multigroomer All-in-One Trimmer Series 3000, 13 Piece Mens Grooming Kit, for Beard, Face, Nose, and Ear Hair Trimmer and Hair Clipper, NO Blade Oil Needed, MG3750/60
review_text: *Philips Norelco Multi Groomer All-in-One***When it comes to grooming tools, finding a versatile, efficient, and reliable device that does it all can feel like searching for a needle in a haystack. But then there’s the *Philips Norelco Multi Groomer All-in-One*—a true game-changer in the world of personal grooming. This sleek and powerful grooming kit is more than just an all-in-one tool; it’s the Swiss Army knife of male grooming devices, designed to handle everything from trimming your beard to shaving, detailing, and even personal care. If you're serious about looking sharp, this is the ultimate grooming companion you didn’t know you needed.**Unmatched Versatility: A Grooming Kit That Does It All**The *Philips Norelco Multi Groomer All-in-One* is a grooming revolution that combines precision, power, and convenience in one package. Whether you're a fan of a clean-shaven look, a neatly trimmed beard, or maintaining a stylish stubble, this tool has got you covered. The wide range of attachments included ensures you can style every inch of your face and body with ease, providing complete control over your grooming routine.What sets this device apart is its sheer versatility. It features multiple trimming guards, shaving heads, and detailed attachments, allowing you to tackle a wide variety of tasks in one compact unit. The kit includes everything you need for:1. **Beard and Mustache Trimming**: With the adjustable guards, you can effortlessly trim your beard or mustache to your desired length. The precise stainless steel blades provide a sharp, clean cut every time, ensuring a smooth, even trim without any nicks or irritation.2. **Head Shaving**: The *Philips Norelco Multi Groomer* includes a razor head that makes shaving your head a breeze. Its ergonomic design allows for a comfortable grip, even when you’re maneuvering around tricky spots like the back of your neck.3. **Nose and Ear Hair Trimming**: One of the often-overlooked aspects of grooming is nose and ear hair. With the included attachment, this device offers precise, pain-free trimming that will have you looking polished and professional from every angle.4. **Body Grooming**: Beyond facial hair, this all-in-one tool is perfect for body grooming. Whether you're shaping your chest, arms, or even sensitive areas like your groin, the tool provides gentle and effective trimming without any tugging or irritation.5. **Detailing and Edge Trimming**: The fine detailing attachment allows you to edge and shape your beard, sideburns, or goatee with surgical precision, ensuring that every line is sharp and clean. Whether you’re going for a classic look or something more modern, the *Philips Norelco Multi Groomer* lets you create defined edges without the hassle.**Precision and Power: Built for Performance**What truly elevates the *Philips Norelco Multi Groomer All-in-One* is its high-performance motor, designed to provide powerful and consistent results, no matter the task. The motor runs smoothly across all attachments, ensuring that every cut is uniform and precise. The sharp stainless steel blades are self-sharpening, so they stay in top condition for longer, reducing the need for regular replacements.The groomer’s ergonomic design ensures maximum comfort and ease of use. It fits comfortably in your hand, providing excellent control as you navigate the contours of your face and body. Whether you’re trimming your beard or shaving your head, the device gives you the power and precision you need to achieve professional-quality results every time.**Long Battery Life and Quick Charging**Another standout feature of the *Philips Norelco Multi Groomer* is its impressive battery life. With up to 60 minutes of runtime on a single charge, you can easily complete your grooming routine without worrying about running out of power midway through. The device charges quickly, so even if you’re in a rush, a quick charge will give you enough juice to finish the job.The convenience of cordless operation allows you to groom freely, without being tethered to an outlet. Whether you’re in your bathroom, on the go, or traveling, the cordless design ensures you have the flexibility to groom whenever and wherever you need.**Waterproof Design: Groom Anywhere, Anytime**One of the most impressive features of the *Philips Norelco Multi Groomer All-in-One* is its waterproof design. Whether you prefer to shave and trim in the shower or clean your device under running water, this groomer is completely washable and waterproof. The ability to use the device in wet or dry conditions adds a layer of convenience, allowing you to groom your way, without worrying about water damage.Cleaning the device is just as simple. After use, simply rinse the attachments under warm water to maintain cleanliness and hygiene. The waterproof design makes maintenance a breeze, ensuring that your grooming tool stays in top shape for years to come.**Durable, Long-Lasting Construction**The *Philips Norelco Multi Groomer* is built to last, with durable, high-quality materials that withstand daily use. From the sturdy body to the razor-sharp blades, every component is designed with longevity in mind. You’ll appreciate the feel of a solid, well-built device in your hand, and its long-lasting construction means you won’t need to worry about wear and tear anytime soon.**The Ideal Grooming Companion for Any Man**The *Philips Norelco Multi Groomer All-in-One* isn’t just another grooming tool—it’s the only tool you’ll ever need. Whether you're maintaining your facial hair, shaving your head, or tackling body grooming tasks, this device offers complete flexibility and performance to meet every need. With its range of attachments, precision, power, and user-friendly design, this multi-groomer is the ideal companion for any man who values efficiency and style.**Final Verdict: A Grooming Essential for Every Man**In conclusion, the *Philips Norelco Multi Groomer All-in-One* is a must-have for anyone looking to streamline their grooming routine. It offers the perfect balance of versatility, power, and ease of use, making it suitable for all your grooming needs. From trimming and shaving to detailed edging and body grooming, this tool handles it all with ease and precision.With its durable design, impressive battery life, and waterproof functionality, the *Philips Norelco Multi Groomer* is built to last, ensuring you’ll enjoy a top-notch grooming experience every time. Say goodbye to cluttered countertops filled with multiple grooming tools and embrace the convenience and power of this all-in-one solution.This is the grooming device you’ve been waiting for. With the *Philips Norelco Multi Groomer All-in-One*, you’ll achieve a professional-level grooming experience at home—effortlessly and with style. If you’re serious about your grooming routine, this tool will become your new best friend.

product_name: Renogy 1000W Pure Sine Wave Inverter with ECO Mode, 12V DC to AC 120V 110V Converter for Off-Grid Solar System, Home, RV, Solar Power Inverter with Remote Switch, Surge 2000W
review_header: Decent Performance, But with Notable Flaws
review_text: I’ve been using this inverter for a few weeks now, and while it does its job most of the time, there are a few issues that make it less than ideal. The main problem I’ve encountered is that it occasionally indicates a battery failure even though the battery is perfectly fine. This can be frustrating, as it makes troubleshooting more difficult than it should be.Additionally, the much-advertised ECO feature doesn’t seem to work at all. It’s disappointing because I specifically chose this model for its promised energy-saving capabilities.On the positive side, it’s easy to set up and handles moderate loads without any hiccups.

product_name: Renogy 1000W Pure Sine Wave Inverter with ECO Mode, 12V DC to AC 120V 110V Converter for Off-Grid Solar System, Home, RV, Solar Power Inverter with Remote Switch, Surge 2000W
review_header: 6 months of lite use and it caught FIRE
review_text: See the title. I bought this based on reviews and Renogy brand name. Mistakes on my part.Add to Renogy requiring a SKU to file a claim. I'm not finding that on my Amazon order. This only runs 2-6 a day. TV, small lamp, Amazon Dot.Thankfully it was installed where we could see and smell the smoke.I have a 2nd one new in the box that I'll not be installing. What if this had happened with installed in my camper basement next to my battery bank? No 2nd chances when it comes to safety.

product_name: Renogy 1000W Pure Sine Wave Inverter with ECO Mode, 12V DC to AC 120V 110V Converter for Off-Grid Solar System, Home, RV, Solar Power Inverter with Remote Switch, Surge 2000W
review_text: The Eco mode (the main reason I bought this) only works with something that pulls a lot of power. If you want to run a low wattage light bulb, you have to physically go behind the inverter and change the settings.  I have a Victron and it runs whatever I need, big pull or small. I wanted to like this Renogy but the Eco mode is useless. The inverter drains the batteries on regular mode.

product_name: Renogy 1000W Pure Sine Wave Inverter with ECO Mode, 12V DC to AC 120V 110V Converter for Off-Grid Solar System, Home, RV, Solar Power Inverter with Remote Switch, Surge 2000W
review_text: I am impressed with the noise level using this inverter. It is in my rv and is very quiet.  I have used it with a crockpot, immersion blender and my laptop just fine.  If you are going to max it out it does get more noisy but is still not bad.  For weekend use boondocking this is right for me. For more full time use I would go with a larger watt model.

product_name: Clearly GLOW Teeth Whitening Activated Charcoal Powder + Ultra Soft Bamboo Toothbrush | Pure, Natural, Food Grade, Non GMO, Made in USA | Whiten Teeth Naturally (20g)
review_header: Worth the extra work I need to do for the results
review_text: I read a lot of the reviews saying that it's messy, so with that in mind, I use a little spoon to scoop out a pinch to put in a lipped sauce dish. I wet my toothbrush, shake off the excess water (it turns the charcoal to water rather than a paste if there's too much water on your brush), then I start brushing.This product whitened my teeth about a quarter to half a shade whiter on the very first night I tried it! I'm now at a week into using it and the results are definitely starting to show at a much slower pace. I started to feel like it stopped working for me, but as with all products, since it's only been a week, I will definitely give it more time. Assuming it will be about a month before you actually notice results. Definitely use a different toothbrush. I used a new brush and after 2 days, it's already black where the bristles are attached to the plastic, originally clear plastic with white bristles.There is definitely no taste to the product, but for some reason, that threw me off and made me gag the first 2 nights I used it. I'm getting better with it now, so the lack of taste is actually fine. There *is* a chalky/powdery feeling in your mouth, however, which doesn't go away until you completely rinse (and brush with regular toothpaste afterward) and that texture feels gross to me. Still worth the results!Also, after using this product, I now have to rinse my sink every night, wash it every week, rinse my arm every night, and probably will have to get an apron haha. DON'T wear a white shirt. The charcoal spittle spots are NOTICEABLE! And in my experience, it doesn't really come out unless you rub it in soap really hard or wash it right away.MUCH smaller container than I expected, but it will go a long way.

product_name: Isabella’s Clearly GLOW Coconut, Teeth Whitening Activated Charcoal Powder | Pure, Natural, Food Grade, Non GMO, Made in USA | Whiten Teeth Naturally
review_text: I used this stuff for the first time and was shocked made an enormous black mess and it seemed to coat everything in a fine black powder and was difficult to wipe off.  It was quite a shock to look up and see my lips and teeth all black.  I look like I’m getting ready for Halloween!  Now after thoroughly rinsing it did leave a very nice mouth feel and a very fresh taste in my mouth and it did get rid of the metallic taste that I had been experiencing.  I do continue to use it occasionally and very sparingly a little goes a long way!!  And don’t forget no swallowing and lots and lots of rinsing!! Whatever u do don’t have on any special clothing item because I would be worried it may not come out of fabrics.  I could be wrong there but the way it smears on the sink and countertops...I wouldn’t chance it.  Be extra careful when opening it for the first time it emits a black dust cloud when I first opened it and it went everywhere!!

product_name: Second Generation FIT (Fecal Immunochemical Test) for Colorectal Cancer (2)
review_header: Actual test looks different from test on cover of box
review_text: The test was easy to use, but I noticed the test I received  has the letters "FOB" at the top. This is different from what the test looks like on the cover of the box which says "FIT" and has "Pinnacle Biolabs" on the front. The discrepancy seemed a little odd to me. I did try to google the difference between a FIT test (Fecal Immunochemical Test) and an FOB test (Fecal occult blood test) and it's possible a FIT test is a type of FOB test.

product_name: Squat Wedge Block Pair, Squat Ramp, Calf Raise Block, Anti-Slip Slant Board for Squats, ATG Equipment to Boost Workout, 17° Incline, 3.5x5.9x12.2, Backpack Included

review_text: We love using these block in our gym. The ONLY four stars are given is because if walking shoes with smooth treads are worn, you can't set your feet high on the blocks because you slide. There's not much grip.

product_name: Squat Wedge Block Pair, Squat Ramp, Calf Raise Block, Anti-Slip Slant Board for Squats, ATG Equipment to Boost Workout, 17° Incline, 3.5x5.9x12.2, Backpack Included
review_text: My sister reccomended that I try using squat wedges to help with my squats.  I decided to try the Flexelent wedges and have been using them for the past 2 weeks, and I already see and feel improvements!The angle helps you get your hips in the right position, making it easier to squat deeper without compromising on form. One of the things I love most about these wedges is how portable they are, I can throw them in my gym bag and take them wherever I go – whether it's the gym, to my friends home gym or even just moving them around my own home workout area.  They're super lightweight but sturdy enough to handle all the different squatting exercise I like to do.  Because it is two separate wedges, I can adjust the width of my stance and I can also turn them outward for sumo squats.If you're serious about improving your squats, try these wedges and you will be happy you added them into to your workouts.

product_name: Squat Wedge Block Pair, Squat Ramp, Calf Raise Block, Anti-Slip Slant Board for Squats, ATG Equipment to Boost Workout, 17° Incline, 3.5x5.9x12.2, Backpack Included
review_header: Decent product with a couple flaws
review_text: Positives: light weight, versatility.Negatives: incredibly slippery- with almost any shoe I had an issue keeping traction, however some non slip tape works wonders. Sturdiness- there seems to be a little bit of give. 6/10 on the sturdiness.

review_header: This is a very well thought out front desk for a smaller space
review_text: Surprisingly easy to assemble, though part do require 2 people. The fit and finish of this desk are a high quality, I could not have made a better choice for what I need.I would certainly buy this desk again if I had the needTwo things I would do different but are not negatives --it comes with a stand to hold a tower computer. It would better serve, for those of us who hang our computers on the back of our monitors, if the shelf had those 2 extra holes drilled so it could be used as a stand alone holder for say a UPS batter back up device,The large for on the short l is one tall space. product_name: Vanity Table Set with Lighted Mirror, Makeup Table with 3 Shelves and 5 Drawers, Dressing Vanity Tables, Dresser Desk for Girls, Women, White
review_header: Extremely Cheap/Pieces Don't Fit - Do Not Waste Your Time/Money
review_text: I completely agree with other reviews: "The instructions are simple enough. The material is so cheap, though, you'll destroy it if you use an electric screwdriver, which means you have to manually screw in 109 screws. The holes are not pre-drilled for the brackets that make the seat sturdier...My next step is to reach out to Amazon, but, honestly, if I have to take this thing back apart in order to get money back, I'm going to lose my mind. The product is grossly misrepresented in the description. Disappointed doesn't even begin to describe how I'm feeling after spending a couple of hours on this."I did reach out to customer service and they tried to help by sending me another drawer (not another seat after after agreeing to send both) after two months. I don't have any more time to devote to this. I learned my lesson to buy something local and not deal with furniture from amazon with no customer support again. I would like my money back. Please do not buy. Not worth your time, frustration and money.

product_name: AIEGLE Large Kitchen Hutch Storage Cabinet, Pantry Cabinets with Hutch, Metal Frame Cupboard with Mesh Door, Drawer & Microwave Shelf, Freestanding Kitchen Storage, Brown (59" W x 15.7" D x 68.5" H)
review_header: DIDNT LIKE THE COLOR - SO I CHANGED IT :)
review_text: great set up! I am using this as a dresser, actually. rather that what its intended for. I needed a place to hang my shorts up, so I opted not to install the middle shelf. That way I was able to install a clothing rod and hang up my shorts as desired. I also wasn't too keen on the color, didn't match anything in my house, and considering they only seem to make the large size in one color... I changed it. Originally just sanded down the pieces that would be visible, primed and painted them all black. I did this before I put it together, so that way I had more control over the mess. Halfway through, I got the bright idea to add a bit of my flare to it, and as you can see... went a little crazy. Im really happy with how it turned out, however. Also, for the top outside left and right cubbie type things, I opted not to install the black mesh cabinet door, that way I could give a home to these 2 infinity mirrors I took from another piece of furniture. Turned out the dimensions of the shelves for the top-right and top-left parts of this thing, just so perfectly matched the dimensions of these infinity mirrors... well... almost. Installed an LED strip behind the metal support bar underneath the top section, as to light up the counter space, and another LED strip behind the metal backing thing, with the oblong hole pattern. to give it some back-lighting, or whatever you might call that. As for the actual product, though. NO complaints. Easy to install. Sturdy materials, looks great (even better now!), and functionality is perfect, and super versatile. Think outside the box! It says "kitchen pantry cabinet" but could be used for a number of things. Options are endless once you use your imagination :)

product_name: AIEGLE Large Kitchen Hutch Storage Cabinet, Pantry Cabinets with Hutch, Metal Frame Cupboard with Mesh Door, Drawer & Microwave Shelf, Freestanding Kitchen Storage, Brown (59" W x 15.7" D x 68.5" H)
review_header: Great hutch but check pieces all carefully
review_text: UPDATE: The legs on my unit weren’t mislabeled after all, they were just made incorrectly so some of the holes were “backwards” and there was also an entire hole missing on one. I was able to mess with it and still get the backing on, but there’s nothing I can do about the hole that’s not there. I mean, I could drill a new one, but it’s sturdy enough without it so I’m not going to risk it. Overall, this is a really sturdy, good-looking hutch. Just make sure you carefully look over all your pieces when you get them before starting it, so you can figure out if you can work around it or if you’ll need to contact the seller/return it.ORIGINAL: First of all, these thing is heavy and will be very sturdy when/if you get it fully set up. Second, you need to read through the instructions and lay out all the parts before attempting to put it together. After doing that, you also need to go through the instructions step by step and make sure that every part (EVERY single part) is correctly labeled - especially the ones that are mirrored/used on opposite sides of the hutch. I almost had the base constructed when I realized that pieces 1 and 2 (the legs/lower side bars) had been swapped, so I had to undo several steps to fix it. They have to be installed correctly or the whole base will be backwards. Also be careful because the instructions have you assembling it front side down - which means the drawer slides are constantly sliding down, making installation (and disassembly) tricky. In the process of undoing everything to swap the legs where they should be, one of the drawer slides slid and snapped out which is fixable, but frustrating. I’ve inspected every other piece and from here on out they all seem to be labeled correctly — it was just 1 and 2 that were switched. All that said, it is a really nice hutch - but god help you if anything is mislabeled.

product_name: Clearly GLOW Teeth Whitening Activated Charcoal Powder + Ultra Soft Bamboo Toothbrush | Pure, Natural, Food Grade, Non GMO, Made in USA | Whiten Teeth Naturally (20g)
review_text: I knew it would be messy, and there's even a warning label that says to be careful but WOW nothing could have prepared me for this stuff. It gets EVERYWHERE. It's like laser toner it just shoots and floats around. It sticks to everything: marble, ceramic, my hands, tongue, gums, even the toothbrush itself is hard to clean. I had to use a scouring pad to clean my bathroom sink after I was done. After showering, multiple tooth brushings and waterpikking I still have some of it stuck to my gums and tongue.I was inspired by the other reviewers who had significant whitening after just one use. I am happy for them but my teeth did not get any whiter so there is no way I am going to bother with the hassle of using this again.

product_name: Clearly GLOW Teeth Whitening Activated Charcoal Powder + Ultra Soft Bamboo Toothbrush | Pure, Natural, Food Grade, Non GMO, Made in USA | Whiten Teeth Naturally (20g)
review_text: I want to love this product however I am just not able too. I have been using it for almost a week now and have been fining that the charcoal gets up under my gum line. It is hard to get it out and it is super annoying to have it under there. I am going to have to stop using this product and look for a different way to whiten my teeth.

product_name: Squat Wedge Block Pair, Squat Ramp, Calf Raise Block, Anti-Slip Slant Board for Squats, ATG Equipment to Boost Workout, 17° Incline, 3.5x5.9x12.2, Backpack Included
review_header: Yes, you need these for your squats
review_text: I’ve been looking for squat wedges to help me reach a good depth and to help me stay in a more upright position while in the squat.The Flexent wedges are the ones that called out to me with the pop in color and overall design. Once they came in, I was very impressed with how sturdy they felt, considering how lightweight they are.It’s good to know that elevating the heels during squats can help to alleviate tightness in the calves and ankles, which I believe allowed me to achieve a deeper squat with better form. These wedges also help target the quads and glutes more effectively, which is great as I am focusing on building those quad muscles. #gainsThe lightweight, portable design of the Flexent wedges makes them easy to incorporate into your routine at the gym, at home, or wherever you do your fitness (they even come with a bag).Overall, these wedges are a smart investment for anyone looking to enhance their exercise experience, to ensure that you are hitting the depth that you want, to build up your quad muscles, and to achieve even better results. No lie, you need these in your routine!

product_name: Squat Wedge Block Pair, Squat Ramp, Calf Raise Block, Anti-Slip Slant Board for Squats, ATG Equipment to Boost Workout, 17° Incline, 3.5x5.9x12.2, Backpack Included
review_header: Big wedges but not for bigger feet
review_text: These wedges are nice. They feel solid, have grips on the bottom and have wide coverage. My feet are size 9.5 (W)/size 8 (M) and they fit but if my feet were any bigger, they probably wouldn’t fit on these wedges. I haven’t used them for longer exercises yet but my initial experience using these to do squats is that my posture feels more upright and I feel better supported using these wedges.

review_text:
The media could not be loaded.
                
            
                
            
            
        
    
    








  
  
    We love how much our new pantry hutch has organized & cleaned up the look of our kitchen. It's holding snacks & food, desk items, crafts & all the stuff that I just don't know what to do with (without throwing it out)! My counter tops & bar are cleared off. My everyday items that I need handy are in a drawer that amazes me at just how deep it is & how much it holds. I don't have to dig thru cabinets & baskets to find what I need anymore! Happy with this item is an under statement!The assembly was beyond my ability so my daughter & son-in-law spent an afternoon (6 hours @ a casual pace) getting it all together. Also, this is a very heavy item @ 200lbs. It arrived in two boxes of 100lbs each & the FedEx driver wasn't too accommodating when asked to bring up 6 steps to our porch, so he left the boxes at the bottom of the stairs.It's a very sturdy piece, no cardboard, even for drawer bottoms. It has adjustable feet if there's a need for evening up the levelness. The dimensions are as stated in description. The rustic color with black mesh & peg board backing are complimentary for our decor. I've purchased other shelves in same color & they all blend perfectly. This unit did not come with an electrical outlet or lighting. I've added a small surge protector & decorative lamp. I'm also going to add a small motion light to the drawer that holds my 'desk' items.We love it!

product_name: AIEGLE Large Kitchen Hutch Storage Cabinet, Pantry Cabinets with Hutch, Metal Frame Cupboard with Mesh Door, Drawer & Microwave Shelf, Freestanding Kitchen Storage, Brown (59" W x 15.7" D x 68.5" H)
review_text: Pros: - The "veneer" is plastic, not wood. This is good thing because it's thick and durable. For me, this isn't simply going to sit and look pretty - it's going to get some use. I appreciate it. - It's sturdy - it does not feel flimsy and don't have any concerns about putting things on it (including up top). - pretty decent build quality for materials. You can tell they went the extra mile on some things. Though for the price, I guess that's kind of expected. For example, the slide rails for the draws.. very nice! The draws themselves don't feel flimsy or such. The back boards are thick and veneered on both sides.- I do like the design and size of it (I got the darker model)- It's each to remove and not use the screen doors. That's nice, if you decide to change the look slightly. Cons: - This is an intermediate-advanced level assembly. Take your time. It will take hours. It's easy to accidently use two sets of screws, as they have the same threads and look similar, and this can give you headaches later on (pro tip: the 4 medium length black screws with allen heads - they are for the joining the top and bottom sections - don't use the longer ones for this) - for the price range, it could have paid $30-50 more and probably got something that had a little bit better look (but functionally, this is fine). Overall - very pleased with the hutch, impressed with the quality of it, and feel confident in the product.

product_name: Curio Display Cabinet with Light, Storage Shelves with Pop-up Glass Doors, 2 Drawers & 3 Color Light, Collectibles Cabinet Display Shelf, Bookshelf Showcase for Living Room, Black w/Drawer
review_text: I purchased three of these cabinets for my toy collection and I totally love them! The well packaged order arrived quickly. The assembly process was fairly easy with the detailed instruction booklet. The cabinet dimensions are by far better than other cabinets. This cabinet has five shelves instead of four and the spacing between the shelves is 15 inches which is much better than other cabinets. The LED lighting strips are easy to install with three color options. The cabinet is manufactured wood but very heavy and sturdy. The glass doors are framed in metal and I love the slow door close feature. The cabinet does not come with the needed USB cube for the lights to work as well as the cam hole covers which I had to purchase separately. I too was very troubled with the cloudy glass that would not clean with Windex or alcohol, but after I combine my own glass cleaner with Distilled white vinegar, Dawn dish soap and warm water, the cloudy film and marks on the glass came right off and the glass is perfectly clear and beautiful. There was no instruction in the booklet on how to clean this cabinet so you just have to figure it out. It requires elbow grease work to get this cabinet clean but in the long run, it’s by far the better display cabinet for my needs and I am very impressed and love it very much. Thank you.

product_name: Philips Norelco Multigroomer All-in-One Trimmer Series 3000, 13 Piece Mens Grooming Kit, for Beard, Face, Nose, and Ear Hair Trimmer and Hair Clipper, NO Blade Oil Needed, MG3750/60
review_header: What you need to know, 9 paragraphs of advice
review_text: 1. Booklet writes it takes 8 hrs to charge and 60 minutes of usage. (That is why I like battery powered trimmers, just have an extra set when it dies. I don't have to wait until it recharges.) There is a emergency charge time, that will give you 5 minutes of usage.2. Read the pamphlet. It has important information about charging and usage.3. I have a beard. I saw the video with the person with a beard that said he cuts his beard with the 12mm guard. I used the 9mm guard, and I wouldn't use a guard shorter than this.  My wife said any shorter, and it wouldn't be called a beard. She didn't want it shorter. I trim my beard once every 2 weeks. I recommend one should start  with the 16mm guard and work your way down.I plan to use the 16mm guard the next time. I used the 5mm guard for the mustache.4. To take off the blade. You hold it from the top and pushed upwards and towards the back of blade. The bottom part of the blade is attached to the shaver handle. It is a plastic fitting, so be careful. Lift off the top part which is the blade, then you can remove the attachment from the shaver handle.5. I am concerned that the plastic guards might break while attaching them, and again when removing them.6. The mini precise blade, is very convenient.7. The nose blade is not sufficient in removing noticeable hairs. You might need to use the mini blade.8. I have the guard attachments and nose blade in a zip lock bag. The shaver with a 16mm guard, 5 mm guard, and the mini blade are in a second zip lock bag. Then I put them into the bag that came with the beard trimmer. This way there won't be hair laying around in the drawers.9. The number for the guard size is on the outside of the guard, below the guard blades. The numbers on the inside, I presume are the parts number. It isn't easy to read the guard size number, since it is molded into the guard. I had to turn it in an angle that the light would reflect onto the number.

product_name: Philips Norelco Multigroomer All-in-One Trimmer Series 3000, 13 Piece Mens Grooming Kit, for Beard, Face, Nose, and Ear Hair Trimmer and Hair Clipper, NO Blade Oil Needed, MG3750/60
review_header: Affordable, Versatile, and Reliable Grooming Solution
review_text: Affordable, Versatile, and Reliable Grooming Solution!After using the Philips Norelco Multi Groomer Series 3000, I can confidently say it’s one of the best grooming kits in its price range. It offers a wide range of attachments for various grooming needs while being easy to use and maintain. Here’s my in-depth review:1. Build Quality and DesignThe trimmer has a sleek and lightweight design, making it comfortable to hold and maneuver during grooming. The build quality feels solid, especially for the price. The attachments fit securely onto the trimmer, and swapping them out is quick and easy.2. Versatility with AttachmentsThis kit comes with 13 attachments designed to handle every grooming task:Beard and Face: The precision trimmer and various guards allow for easy shaping, trimming, and detailing. I’ve been able to maintain a clean, sharp beard line without hassle.Nose and Ear Hair: The dedicated nose and ear trimmer works well and doesn’t pull or tug on hair, which is a big plus.Hair Clipping: The hair clipper guards are great for touch-ups and trimming short hairstyles. It won’t replace a full-size clipper for heavy-duty haircuts but is perfect for maintenance.The variety of guards ensures you can achieve the exact length and style you’re going for. Whether you’re looking for a close trim or something longer, this kit has you covered.3. PerformanceThe trimmer is powered by DualCut technology, which ensures a fast and precise trim. The blades are self-sharpening and stay effective even after months of use. I’ve noticed consistent performance every time, and it doesn’t struggle with thicker hair.What I love most is how quiet the motor is compared to other trimmers I’ve used. It feels smooth and doesn’t overheat during use.4. Maintenance-Free BladesOne of the standout features of this trimmer is that it doesn’t require blade oiling. This makes maintenance effortless. A quick rinse of the attachments under water after use is all you need to keep them clean.5. Battery LifeThe trimmer boasts an impressive 60 minutes of cordless use after a full charge, which is more than enough for multiple grooming sessions. Charging it takes about 8 hours, so I usually leave it plugged in overnight. For the price, the battery performance is excellent.6. Portability with Travel PouchThis trimmer is compact and lightweight, and the included travel pouch is a fantastic addition. It keeps the trimmer and all the attachments organized, making it easy to carry everything for trips. The dual voltage capability is also perfect for international travel.7. Value for MoneyFor the price, this grooming kit delivers exceptional value. You’re getting a reliable, all-in-one solution that works for various grooming needs without breaking the bank.Things to Consider:The long charge time (8 hours) might be a drawback for some, but the 60-minute runtime more than makes up for it.It’s not designed for heavy-duty haircuts, so if you’re looking for a professional-grade clipper for thick hair, you might need something more powerful.Final VerdictThe Philips Norelco Multi Groomer Series 3000 is an excellent choice for anyone looking for an affordable and versatile grooming kit. It’s perfect for maintaining your beard, trimming body hair, and handling those pesky nose and ear hairs. The travel pouch and low-maintenance design (no blade oil needed!) make it an even better option for frequent travelers.If you’re in the market for a reliable, all-in-one grooming solution that won’t break the bank, this is the trimmer to get. Highly recommended!

product_name: Renogy 1000W Pure Sine Wave Inverter with ECO Mode, 12V DC to AC 120V 110V Converter for Off-Grid Solar System, Home, RV, Solar Power Inverter with Remote Switch, Surge 2000W
review_header: Worked OK until it didn't - then it was a fire hazard
review_text: I purchased this to add a reliable pure sine inverter to my setup.  It was replacing an old 900w Cobra (non sine) inverter which has served me well for about 8 years.  I was excited as I would be able to run my PC from this unit.Setup was easy, no issues with install.  The unit had some heft and looked of top-notch build quality.I did notice that the ECO feature didn't always work, it would occasionally fault with a 120w restart load.  This would require me to go into the cabinet and manually flick the switch off and on.  I eventually just kept it set to the ON mode rather than having it fail intermittently and beeping at me.  Just a mild annoyance that the ECO mode didn't work as advertised, which is why I bought this model rather than the Non-ECO version.  I have enough solar to not worry about the small load the inverter itself took...  So not a deal-breakerI ran this for a month with no issues (beside the previously mentioned ECO faults), never pulling more than 250w max (outside of initial setup testing which I pulled 800w for 2 minutes)  Normal workload was between 30-120w constant (24/7).  So, a rather light work load.  I went with this model in case we have an extended power outage from a storm (I'm in central Florida).  In an emergency it would power a window AC and the kitchen fridge.As luck would have it I was sitting in my office (72F ambient) where it was housed and heard the fans kicking on a bit more than usual.  After about 10 minutes of this I heard a loud POP and the inverter started belching smoke.  It kept running and did not blow the fuse in or out.  I quickly turned it off.  The well ventilated cabinet my solar electrics are housed in was 80F at the time of failure (the inverter is the only heat source in there).This really bothers me.  Whatever safety features are built-in did not work.  I do not work from home and had I not been sitting there as it happened I have no doubt that this would have caused a fire.I use several Renogy panels and a Rover 40li charge controller.  They have worked like a champ - no issues.  Because of this I bought the inverter and the Bluetooth monitor for it.  I thought I was paying a premium for the reliability, however this seems not to be the case.If you own this model, please be careful.  If you are considering buying it, take what you will from my review.  This will be the last Renogy product I purchase.

product_name: Renogy 1000W Pure Sine Wave Inverter with ECO Mode, 12V DC to AC 120V 110V Converter for Off-Grid Solar System, Home, RV, Solar Power Inverter with Remote Switch, Surge 2000W
review_header: Worked for three and a half months
review_text: I bought the first one in April 2024, the cable for the remote panel didn't hold in the outlet which was critical for my case. I returned the unit and Amazon sent a replacement, with no issues. This one worked with a very light load for three and a half months in my travel trailer. Now I can smell burnt electronics from inside, the unit doesn't power on. I will update the review after settling the warranty claim.

product_name: bett1 Bodyguard Anti-Kartell-Matratze | Testsieger Stiftung Warentest: Note 1,6 (Test 2/2024, mittelfest & Fester, 90x200 cm, 2in1 Härtegrade, Bezug waschbar bis 60 Grad, Oeko-TEX 100, QXSchaum)
review_text: Das Produkt ist sehr Hochwertug. Ich bin insgesamt sehr zufrieden mit dieser Matratze – sie bietet einen exzellenten Komfort und passt sich hervorragend meinem Körper an, sodass ich morgens entspannt und erholt aufwache. Der einzige kleine Wermutstropfen ist, dass die weiche Seite für meine persönlichen Verhältnisse etwas zu weich ist. Ein wichtiger Tipp, den ich jedem ans Herz legen möchte: Ein hochwertiger Lattenrost kann einen riesigen Unterschied machen und die Schlafqualität erheblich verbessern. Wer also das Maximum an Erholung aus dieser Matratze herausholen möchte, sollte in einen guten Lattenrost investieren.

product_name: ICQN Rustik Minibackofen 60 Liter XXL mit Umluft, Drehspieß, Emailliert, Anthrazit
review_text: Der Mini-Ofen ist eigentlich ein vollwertiger Ofen für Backbleche in Standardgröße.Fertige Backpapierabschnitte passen ohne Beschnitt.Der Ofen benötigt eine Aufheizzeit, wie ein nomaler Einbauherd. Da sind übliche, kleinere Mini-öfen schneller, wenn es mal darum geht, schnell zwei Brötchen aufzubacken. Das geht zwar auch mit dem ICON 70 Liter, nur sollte man dazu mindestens zwölf Minuten veranschlagen, statt nur acht.Die rote Kontrolllampe erlischt bei erreichter Temperatur. Bis 200 °C erreicht sind, dauert das mehr als 10 Minuten. (Kleingebäck lege ich schon in den kalten Ofen, um Energie zu sparen.)Das Wahlrad für Oberhitze, Unterhitze und Heißluft hat zusätzlich auch eine AUS Position. Der kleine 0/1 Schalter vorne unten rechts am Gerät ist kein Stromschalter, sondern nur zum Ein- und Ausschalten des Drehspießes.Der Drehspieß hat reichlich Länge, weil er diagonal im Ofen eingehängt wird. Die Spitze kommt in eine Öffnung hinten rechts im Backraum und das Ende wird in eine Blechhalterung vorne links im Backraum eingehängt. So passt mehr auf einen Spieß.Die 40°C Joghurt Funktion ist nicht nur für Joghurt praktisch, sondern auch für Hefeteig, der vor dem Backen noch mal gehen soll.Die 80 °C Reinigungsfunktion musste ich noch nicht benutzen. Es wurde kaum der Backraum dreckig, obwohl ich den Ofen täglich benutzte. (Brötchen, selbst gemachte Blechpizza)Positiv, dass man die Backofenlampe einfach austauschen kann, falls defekt. Ein Glaskörper zum Abschrauben ist direkt im Backraum zugänglich.(Problem: Das mehrsprachige, auch deutsche Handbuch erwartet ein Backofen-Leuchtmittel 230 V Typ G9 mit 15 Watt. Bestellen kann ich bei Amazon nur Leuchtmittel dieses Typs mit 25 Watt. Hoffentlich ersetzbar, wenn mal ein Birnen-Tausch fällig wird.)Der separate Haltegriff für heiße Backbleche ist etwas wackelig beim Gebrauch, aber benutzbar.Ich bin mit dem Ofen zufrieden.Unentschieden bin ich nur in der Frage zur Haltbarkeit. Ich besitze das Gerät erst seit einer Woche und der Umluftventilator macht oft laute Geräusche. Hoffentlich kein schlechtes Zeichen.Ansonsten optisch ein Hingucker.Sofern das Gerät nicht schnell schlapp macht, endlich ein vollwertiger Ofen, in dem man auch Größeres backen und garen kann.

product_name: bett1 Bodyguard Anti-Kartell-Matratze | Testsieger Stiftung Warentest: Note 1,6 (Test 2/2024, mittelfest & Fester, 90x200 cm, 2in1 Härtegrade, Bezug waschbar bis 60 Grad, Oeko-TEX 100, QXSchaum)
review_text: Vorwort:Meine alte Matratze von Dunlopillo bekam nach 6 Monaten starke Kuhlen, so dass ich kaum noch schlafen konnte.Habe ich etwas falsch gemacht? Ich würde sagen nein, denn ich hatte ein gutes federndes 7-Zonen-Lattenrost, dazu die Matratze auch oft gewendet und nicht stärker als der Härtegrad war belastet.Alleine der Gedanke ans schlafen machte mich fertig.Doch dann hatte ich viele Berichte über die Bodyguard Matratze gesehen und durchgelesen.So berichteten viele fast nur positives von der Matratze, egal ob Stiftung Warentest, ein Bericht im Fernsehen, ein Youtube Video und die (Amazon)Bewertungen.Die Hoffnung stirbt ja bekanntlich zuletzt, also habe ich die Matratze bei Amazon bestellt.Bestellung:Am 15.11 bestellte ich die Matratze in 90x200 cm, mir wurde eine Lieferzeit von 2-3 Wochen angezeigt. Vermutlich weil sich wirklich sehr viele Käufer über die lange Lieferzeit beschwerten.Geliefert werden sollte sie jedenfalls zwischen  10 - 17. Dezember.Schon am 18.11 bekam ich allerdings die Versandmitteilung per E-Mail.Eine Sendungsverfolgung war auch dabei, versand wurde die Matratze übrigens mittels DPD.Die Paketmaße betragen 120 cm x 40 cm x 40 cm laut E-Mail.Angekommen ist die Matratze dann am 22.11, sprich nach 4 Werktagen war sie schon bei mir.Toll!Lattenrost:Ich benutze für die Bodyguard Matratze ein selbstgebautes Lattenrost, wie z.B. von Stiftung Warentest (Anleitung zum Lattenrostbau) empfohlen.Mit einem "normalen" 7-Zonen-Lattenrost, wie man es fast überall bekommt, könnte die Federung zu stark sein.Im Baumarkt um die Ecke bekommt man jedenfalls die Teile für den Selbstbau-Lattenrost schon für 40 - 60 Euro.Bezug:Ich finde den Bezug richtig gut. Die Rezensionen machten mir aber sorgen, doch der Bezug macht einen stabilen Eindruck, ist dick genug und sehr Luftdurchlässig.Das merkt man schon, wenn man mit der Handfläche auf die Matratze drückt, dann spürt man einen starken Luftzug um die Hand.Ich bin wirklich auf den Sommer gespannt.Der Bezug macht jedenfalls einen guten Eindruck, ich habe bisher nichts zu bemängeln.Härtegrad3(grau/blau, dunkel):Auf dieser Seite habe ich bisher nur geschlafen, da ich diese Seite als hart genug betrachte.Härtegrad4(weiß, hell):Mein erster Eindruck war, wow ziemlich hart, geschlafen habe ich hier erstmal noch nicht.Schlafkomfort:Die Matratze ist anfangs ziemlich hart.Ansonsten muss ich sagen, die angeblichen spürbaren Rillen (laut anderen Rez.) merke ich garnicht, totaler Unsinn meiner Meinung nach.Zum Thema Wärme kann ich noch nicht so viel sagen, wärmer ist das Schlafen jedenfalls nicht geworden, was ja viele behauptet haben.Ich vermute das hängt auch mit dem Bettbezug zusammen, ich nutze ein ganz normales Spannbetttuch.Die erste(n) Nacht(/Nächte):Es war ungewohnt, auf so einer harten und ebenen Matratze zu schlafen.Die erste Nacht und auch die zweite waren erträglich...Doch die dritte Nacht war eine qual, ich bin mit Rückenschmerzen aufgewacht und hatte mich die Nacht über immer hin und her gewälzt.Ich muss dazu sagen, ich bin Nachts Rücken- und Seitenschläfer, tagsüber nur Bauchschläfer, man soll ja Tagsüber nicht wirklich so lange schlafen.Anfangs schlafe ich sehr gerne auf der Seite und dann auf den Rücken, nachts drehe ich mich jedoch sehr gerne wieder auf die Seite.Scheinbar ist die Matratze für den Seitenschlaf anfangs noch zu hart.Nach einer Woche:Nach einer Woche hat es sich merklich gebessert. Ich war am Wochenende morgens aufgewacht undstehe normalerweise sofort auf, weil die alte Matratze eben viel zu weich war und ich nicht mehr liegen konnte.Doch an jenem Samstag nach fast einer Woche mit der BG Matratze, war ich liegen geblieben! Nach so vielen Jahren ist es das erste Mal dass ich so lange im Bett lag und ich hatte keiner Schmerzen!Doch mein Nacken und Rücken waren am Tag etwas verspannt, aber ich muss dazu sagen, ich hatte mir mit der neuen Matratze auch ein neues Kissen gekauft.Nach über zwei Wochen:Ich freue mich endlich wieder auf den Schlaf. Ich hoffe wirklich sehr, dass die Matratze so bleibt und hält was der Hersteller verspricht!Meine HWS Probleme sind schwächer geworden, doch noch habe ich die Matratze nicht lange, daher muss man sehen wie es die nächsten Wochen und vorallem Monate so wird.Ich wollte auch noch erwähnen, ich bewege mich sehr viel am Tag, was den Rücken gut tut und ich empfehle jeden das auch zu tun!Bewegung ist sehr wichtig für den Rücken, auch die Arme beim Laufen mit zu schaukeln.Nach über einem Monat:Etwas weicher geworden und dadurch keine verspannten Schultern mehr!Ich sinke jetzt auf der Seite und auf dem Rücken liegend mehr ein, was den Schultern zugute kommt.Nach 3 Monaten:Ich würde mir glatt noch eine kaufen, hätte ich den Platz, bis jetzt ist sie super!Nach über 1 Jahr:Das UPDATE kommt ende 2017, aber es deutet alles darauf hin, dass sich nichts ändern wird.Ich schlafe bestens auf dieser Matratze, dank neuem Kissen auch ohne Nackenprobleme.Der Rücken war noch nie so dankbar, ich hoffe das bleibt so!Geruch:Ich hatte mich schon auf einen bestialischen Geruch eingestellt.Ja, die Matratze roch schon etwas(!), aber nur, wenn man direkt an diese rangeht und schnuppert.Wenn man genau darüber nachdenkt stellt man fest, es ist einfach nur ein Schaumstoff-Geruch.Mich erinnert diese Situation an ein neues Buch oder Auto, diese haben Produkttechnisch ja auch einen Eigengeruch bzw. NEU-Geruch.Viele mögen diesen "NEU-Geruch"...Die Bodyguard riecht jedenfalls nur wenn man direkt über den Stoff schnuppert oder mit der Hand auf die Matratze drückt.Wenn man sich abends zum Schlafen hinlegt, riecht nichts, dabei bin ich extrem empfindlich bei Gerüchen. Aber wie erwähnt, ich schlafe auf der Seite und den Rücken.Wer auf den Bauch schläft, könnte anfangs den Geruch mehr wahrnehmen.Update Feb 2017: Jetzt ist der dezente Duft komplett verflogen, sogar auf der anderen Seite, auf der ich nie geschlafen habe reicht nichts mehr.Lieferumfang:Der DPD-Bote brachte sie mir vor die Tür, die Matratze war in einem Karton und in Folie. Das Öffnen war sehr einfach, die Matratze war anfangs sehr weich, nach 10-30 Minuten (ich habe nicht auf die Uhr geguckt) war sie voll bereit und hart wie ein Brett.Na gut, nicht wie ein Brett, aber hart.Außerdem war in dem Paket eine Handbuch, dort steht eigentlich alles über die Matratze drin, was man auch hier lesen kann.Kuhlenbildung? Wie ich gelesen habe, passiert dies durch zu viel Gewicht der Person auf der Matratze und durchs schwitzen der selbigen.Die Bodyguard Matratze soll das nicht haben, auch ein wenden ist aufgrund des QXSchaums nicht mehr nötig.Herkömmlichen Kaltschaum braucht wohl eine 3 Monatige Regenerationsphase, blöd nur, dass man eine herkömmliche Matratze alle 2-4 Wochen wenden soll...hier soll das jedenfalls nicht der Fall sein!Bisheriges Fazit:Die meisten Kritiken beziehen sich auf die lange Lieferzeit, dies war mir vorher klar, die Zeit war wesentlich kürzer als gedacht, bestellt wurde mitte November und erhalten habe ich sie auch im November.Bemängelt wird auch der Gestank der Matratze, ich kann das nicht bestätigen, sie hat einen leichten Neu-Geruch, sonst nichts.Und auch ein paar Rezensionen bemängeln die Rillen, diese sollen sehr störend sein, ich habe davon bisher nichts bemerkt.*******************************************************************Ein paar nette Äußerungen vom Verkäufer Bett1-Bodyguard zur Matratze, fast alles steht auch im mitgelieferten HandbuchIch habe die Äußerungen/Antworten mal für Sie zusammengefasst [H3/H4]:1. Die Matratze wird für ein Gewicht bis zu 125 Kilogramm empfohlen.2. Möglichst nicht direkt auf den Boden zu legen, weil die Luftzirkulation eingeschränkt werden kann und sich dies negativ auf das Bettklima auswirkt.Es kann sich daher Schimmel bilden, also bitte immer lüften oder ein Lattenrost nutzen!3. Die BODYGUARD MITTELFEST besteht aus QXSchaum und hat ein Raumgewicht von 35 (Oberseite) und 40 Kilo (Unterseite) pro Kubikmeter.4. QXSchaum reagiert gegenüber herkömmlichen Kaltschäumen überhaupt nicht auf Feuchtigkeitseinwirkung; das hochelastische Verhalten und die stabile Beständigkeit bleiben beim QXSchaum vollkommen erhalten5.Grundsätzlich ist Ihre Matratze für die Benutzung mit allen handelsüblichen starren (unverstellbaren), manuell und motorisch verstellbaren Unterfederungen geeignet. Ob Lattenroste, Tellermodul-Unterfederungen oder Boxspring.6. Der Garantieanspruch beginnt mit Lieferdatum.Der Verkaufsbeleg als Kaufnachweis wird benötigt.Keinerlei handelsüblichen Garantiebeschränkungen, wenn Sie nicht unseren Lattenrost Base verwenden.7. Die Herstellergarantie für unseren Matratzenkern beträgt 10 Jahre ab Lieferdatum.Während der ersten 2 Jahre ab Lieferdatum gewähren wir auf unsereMatratzen eine Garantie, d.h. im Fall des Garantieanspruchs reparierenoder ersetzen wir die Matratze für Sie kostenfrei.8. Die Matratze hat eine Kernhöhe von 18cm und 18,5cm mit Bezug9. Paketmaße: 120cm x 40cm x 40cm, da vakuumiert10. Gerne können Sie sich hinsichtlich des Kaufes einzelner Bezüge direkt telefonisch an unseren Kundenservice wenden.11. Der Matratzenbezug ist bei maximal 60°C waschbar, aber er bietet – wie alle handelsüblichen Matratzenbezüge - keinen hundertprozentigen Schutz bei Milbenallergie. Hausstaubmilbenallergikern empfehlen wir daher die Benutzung so genannter Encasings12. Alle BODYGUARD-Matratzen bestehen aus einem durchgehenden Kern.100 Nächte probeliegen:Wir bieten Ihnen die bequeme und sichere Option Ihre BODYGUARD® 100 Nächte zu Hause zur Probe zu liegen. Wenn Sie nach 100 Nächten nicht zufrieden sein sollten, holen wir die Matratze kostenfrei bei Ihnen ab und erstatten Ihnen umgehend den Kaufpreiszurück – ohne Wenn und Aber.*******************************************************************

product_name: bett1 Bodyguard Anti-Kartell-Matratze | Testsieger Stiftung Warentest: Note 1,6 (Test 2/2024, mittelfest & Fester, 90x200 cm, 2in1 Härtegrade, Bezug waschbar bis 60 Grad, Oeko-TEX 100, QXSchaum)
review_text: Da meine alte Matratze mir schreckliche Rückenschmerzen verursacht hat, musste eine neue her.Ich habe lange gesucht und viele Bewertungen gelesen und bin letztendlich bei dieser hängen geblieben. Ich kaufe eigentlich nicht gerne Sachen, die im Fernsehen angepriesen werden, aber hier haben mich tatsächlich die vielen positiven Bewertungen und die Beschreibung auf der Homepage überzeugt.Die Matratze kam nach 3 Tagen bei mir an. Nach dem Öffnen hatte sie nach Sekunden schon ihre Endform erreicht. Laut Beschreibung braucht sie maximal 8min. Das ist schon fantastisch. Sie gab absolut null Geruch ab und so konnte ich sie nach kurzer Zeit bereits im Bett platzieren. Sie liegt sich total fantastisch und man möchte gar nicht mehr aufstehen. In den ersten 3 Tagen hatte ich nach dem aufstehen noch schlimme Rückenschmerzen aber klar, der Rücken war noch die alte Matratze gewohnt. Doch bereits nach der vierten Nacht bin ich total erholt erwacht. Ich bin mega glücklich mit meinem Kauf und würde sie jederzeit wieder kaufen. Hier ist das Geld definitiv sehr gut investiert.

product_name: bett1 Bodyguard Anti-Kartell-Matratze | Testsieger Stiftung Warentest: Note 1,6 (Test 2/2024, mittelfest & Fester, 90x200 cm, 2in1 Härtegrade, Bezug waschbar bis 60 Grad, Oeko-TEX 100, QXSchaum)
review_header: Meine treue Matratze – 6 Jahre Schlafkomfort und jetzt ein Upgrade!
review_text: Seit 6 Jahren begleitet mich diese Matratze nun schon durch meinen Schlaf. Sie war mein Fels in der Brandung, wenn es um erholsame Nächte ging. Und jetzt, wo ich mich für eine neue Matratze entschieden habe, war es keine Frage, dass es wieder dieses Modell sein musste!Was macht diese Matratze so besonders? * Liegekomfort: Von Anfang an hat mich der Liegekomfort dieser Matratze überzeugt. Sie bietet die perfekte Balance zwischen Stützkraft und Weichheit. Egal ob ich auf dem Rücken, der Seite oder dem Bauch schlafe, ich liege immer bequem und entspannt. * Haltbarkeit: 6 Jahre sind eine lange Zeit, und in diesen Jahren hat die Matratze nichts von ihrer Qualität eingebüßt. Sie ist immer noch genauso bequem wie am ersten Tag. Das spricht für die hochwertige Verarbeitung und die langlebigen Materialien. * Atmungsaktivität: Auch in warmen Nächten habe ich auf dieser Matratze nie geschwitzt. Sie ist atmungsaktiv und sorgt für ein angenehmes Schlafklima. * Vertrauen: Nach 6 Jahren Nutzung weiß ich genau, was ich von dieser Matratze erwarten kann. Ich vertraue ihr und weiß, dass sie mir auch in Zukunft einen guten Schlaf bieten wird.Mein FazitDiese Matratze ist eine Investition in meinen Schlaf und meine Gesundheit. Sie hat mir 6 Jahre lang treue Dienste geleistet und ich bin überzeugt, dass sie das auch weiterhin tun wird. Deshalb habe ich sie mir jetzt auch wieder neu gekauft.Sterne: 5/5 (und das nach 6 Jahren!)Würdest du dieses Produkt weiterempfehlen?Ja, auf jeden Fall! Wenn du auf der Suche nach einer hochwertigen und langlebigen Matratze bist, die dir jahrelang guten Schlafkomfort bietet, dann kann ich dir diese Matratze nur empfehlen.Eine persönliche NoteIch kann mich noch gut an den Kauf meiner ersten Matratze erinnern. Ich war unsicher, welche die richtige ist und habe mich nach langem Überlegen für dieses Modell entschieden. Eine Entscheidung, die ich bis heute nicht bereue. Und jetzt, 6 Jahre später, habe ich mich wieder für sie entschieden. Das sagt eigentlich schon alles!

product_name: bett1 Bodyguard Anti-Kartell-Matratze | Testsieger Stiftung Warentest: Note 1,6 (Test 2/2024, mittelfest & Fester, 90x200 cm, 2in1 Härtegrade, Bezug waschbar bis 60 Grad, Oeko-TEX 100, QXSchaum)
review_text: Selbst gekauft! Bewertung wird etwas ausführlicher, da es seit August unsere 3. Matratze ist und wir sehr schlechte Erfahrungen gemacht haben! Eine davon hat 1.150€ gekostet, also auch teurer ist nicht immer besser. Wir hatten / haben starke Rücken-/ Schulterschmerzen durch die vorherigen Matratzen.Allgemeine Infos zu uns:W, 1.60m, 70kgM, 1.77m, 80kgWir bevorzugen ein weicheres Liegegefühl, aber stabil. Wir bevorzugen eigentlich ein Liegegefühl mit Topper.Wir sind beide Seitenschläfer & BauchschläferGröße: 160x200mWeiches Modell (rot/weiß)Teil 1:Sehr schneller Versand mit DPD. Ich hab die Matratze am 05.01.25 bestellt, Lieferung sollte am 10.-13.01. erfolgen, ich hab sie schon am 09.01. erhalten!Matratzenbezug fühlt sich sehr angenehm anMir fehlt hier eine Angabe, wie lange die Matratze liegen muss, auf der Seite von Bett1 hab ich die Infos gefunden: 8 Minuten!Wir warten allerdings trotzdem einige Stunden.Kein sehr unangenehmer Geruch, einfach der typische „Neugeruch“.Aktuell ein kleiner Knick/Falte im Bezug, siehe Foto 1. ich denke der wird sich noch lösenFoto 1-3 von Matratze frisch ausgerolltTeil 2:11.02.25Wir lieben die Matratze. Man sinkt wirklich angenehm in den verschiedenen Zonen ein, absolut für Seitenschläfer geeignet!Wir reagieren beide mit starken Rückenschmerzen auf eine zu harte Matratze. Diese Matratze hat unsere Beschwerden gelindert, endlich können wir bequem schlafen.Wir haben den E*ma Pre*ium Topper dazugekauft, der verschlechtert die Matratze, er sorgt wie ein viel härteres Liegegefühl. Wir haben dadurch wieder Rückenschmerzen bekommen und geben den zurück.Ohne den Topper ist die Matratze aber wirklich zu empfehlen.Wir haben leider nur 18cm genommen, weil wir von Anfang an einen Topper dazugeplant haben  (den wir nun nicht wollen). Unser Bettrahmen ist niedrig, da wäre die höhere Variante also besser gewesen 😀

product_name: bett1 Bodyguard Anti-Kartell-Matratze | Testsieger Stiftung Warentest: Note 1,6 (Test 2/2024, mittelfest & Fester, 90x200 cm, 2in1 Härtegrade, Bezug waschbar bis 60 Grad, Oeko-TEX 100, QXSchaum)
review_header: Chemiegestank, der nur sehr sehr langsam nachlässt
review_text: Lieferung: Also, ich habe die Matratze wenige Tage nach der Bestellung sehr zügig und einwandfrei erhalten.Entfaltung: Tatsächlich entfaltet sie sich in wenigen Minuten und ist dann stabil, formgerecht und theoretisch einsatzbereit.Geruchsbelästigung und Emissionen: Tatsächlich ist der Geruch nach beizenden Chemikalien aber so heftig, dass das Atmen im Raum mit der Matratze eine heftige Zumutung darstellt. Der abnorme Gestank, anders kann ich es nicht bezeichnen, dauert dann eine 1 Woche an, ehe es ganz ganz langsam besser wird.Schlafkomfort: Ich habe die Matratze nach 10 Tagen 1 x nutzen müssen, da ich Besuch hatte. Der Liegekomfort ist zwar etwas hart, aber die Matratze stützt den Körper gut. Die gesamte Bettwäsche roch nach Chemie und nur mit geöffnetem Fenster war das Schlafen möglich, ich würde insoweit sagen, es war eine Zumutung, aber es ging nicht anders.Herstellerangaben: In der nun 3. Woche riecht der Raum in dem ich die Matratze lagere (unter meinem Bett) immer noch ein wenig nach Chemie und es empfiehlt sich das Lüften nach einigen Stunden. Der Hersteller hat im Beipackzettel vermerkt, dass sich der Geruch nach spätestens 14 Tagen gelegt haben sollte. Das kann ich leider so nicht bestätigen. Es müffelt immer noch nach Chemie, und das ist kein wirklich schöner Geruch.Viele Rezensenten berichten, sie hätten keinen oder nur einen allenfalls kurzen Geruch wahrgenommen. Hier frage ich mich wirklich, wie authentisch solche Berichte sind.Mich erinnert das an eine bekannte Nackenstützkopfkissen-Firma, die vor 20 Jahren ihre Kissen ebenfalls so auslieferten, dass diese erstmal für 3 Wochen in den Keller zum Auslüften verbannt werden mussten, ehe diese wunderbaren Kissen, die ich bis heute x-mal nachbestellt habe, ihren komfortablen Zweck erfüllten.Diese Firma hat aber in den Jahren den Gestank beim Produkt immer weiter reduziert bzw die Kissen schon so lange vorher vom Werk aus auslüften lassen, dass sie heute praktisch vom ersten Tag an nutzbar sind. Ich würde dem Hersteller anraten, die Matratzen lange genug von Werk aus auszulüften,  soweit das Material danach noch eine Kompression zwecks Auslieferung aushält.Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis: Der Preis von 199,- Euro ist okay, soweit die Matratze einige Jahre durchhält.Kaufempfehlung: Ja, aber es sollte klar sein, dass die Matratze einige Wochen Zeit zum auslüften benötigt.Wegen des extremen Geruchsbildes, das die Nutzqualität in den ersten Wochen erheblich einschränkt, halte ich  3 von 5 möglichen Sternen für angemessen.
